channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These brain implants speak your mind — even when you don't want to
item.description: Brain-implanted devices that allow paralyzed people to speak can also decode words they imagine, but don't intend to share.

item.title: Trump's return to 'law and order' highlights a sore spot for Democrats: crime policy
item.description: Democrats have struggled to counter GOP efforts to frame itself as the party of "law and order." Some see it as a problem of messaging, while others t...

item.title: Voting officials are leaving their jobs at the highest rate in decades
item.description: Some 2 in 5 of all the local officials who administered the 2020 election left their jobs before the 2024 cycle, new research has found.

item.title: Israeli military will call up 50,000 reservists as it plans new phase of war in Gaza
item.description: An Israeli official said that the military will be operating in parts of Gaza City where the Israeli military has not yet operated and where Hamas is ...

item.title: Nerd! How the word popularized by Dr. Seuss went from geeky insult to mainstream
item.description: Nerd has been part of our lexicon for three-quarters of a century, its geeky meaning embodied by some of the most recognizable characters in film and ...

item.title: Dozens of Afghan deportees from Iran killed in bus crash
item.description: At least 17 children were among those killed after the bus crashed and caught fire on its way to Kabul.

item.title: Family of NZ fugitive on the run with children pleads for return
item.description: Tom Phillips and his children have been missing since 2021, in a case that has gripped New Zealand.

item.title: Heavy rain paralyses India's financial capital Mumbai
item.description: Nearly 600 people were rescued from a stalled monorail system and 350 others have been shifted to shelters.

item.title: Kremlin plays down Zelensky talks as Trump warns Putin may not want to make deal
item.description: The US president conceded the war in Ukraine was "tough to solve" after several days of high-level talks.

item.title: Native Americans want to avoid Medicaid snafus as work requirements loom
item.description: As states prepare to implement changes to Medicaid required by President Trump's recent tax-and-spending law, tribal leaders say they are concerned Na...

item.title: Hurricane Erin could bring "life-threatening" surf, rip currents to East Coast
item.description: Meteorologists are closely tracking the projected path and forecast of Hurricane Erin, which is the first hurricane to develop over the Atlantic this ...

item.title: 8/19: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump working to arrange summit between Putin, Zelenskyy; Trump vows to try to ban mail-in voting and voting machines

item.title: Trump admin could block student loan relief for some public servants
item.description: Proposed Department of Education rule could deny loan forgiveness to borrowers whose employers are found to be illegally "undermining national securit...

item.title: 6 severed heads found on road with message about revenge
item.description: Messages are often left on victims' bodies by cartels seeking to threaten their rivals or punish behavior they claim violates their rules.

item.title: DR Congo rebels killed 140 civilians despite peace process, rights group says
item.description: Attacks were carried out in more than a dozen villages last month, Human Rights Watch says.

item.title: First domino in national redistricting fight likely to fall with Texas GOP poised for vote on maps
item.description: Texas’ Republican-led legislature is expected to approve new congressional maps that add five new House seats that the GOP could win.

item.title: Even at the grocery store, Texas troopers don’t let Democrats out of sight after walkout
Immigrants seeking lawful work and citizenship are now subject to ‘anti-Americanism’ screening
